TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit EntityDescriptor extends System.Data.Services.Client.Descriptor
Public NotInheritable Class EntityDescriptor Inherits Descriptor

Docs.summary: Description of modifications done to entities by operations returned in a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext.SaveChanges%2A> method returns a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceResponse> object that contains a series of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.OperationResponse> objects each of which contains a sequence of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.EntityDescriptor> or <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.LinkDescriptor> instances that represent changes that were persisted.
For successful operations, the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.Descriptor.State*> property of the descriptor will be set to unchanged and the new values for insert and update operations will be merged according to the merge settings.
For operations with errors, the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.Descriptor.State*> of the descriptor will remain the same as it was before <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext.SaveChanges%2A> was called.
If an error occurred and processing stopped during an operation, the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.Descriptor.State*> will remain unchanged.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property EditLink As Uri
public: property Uri ^ EditLink { Uri ^ get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URI that modifies the entity.

public: property Uri ^ EditStreamUri { Uri ^ get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URI that modifies the binary property data of the entity.
Docs.value: The property contains the edit-media link URI for the Media Resource that is associated with the entity, which is a Media Link Entry.

public: property System::Object ^ Entity { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the entity that contains the update data.
Docs.value: An object that contains update data.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ETag As String
public: property System::String ^ ETag { System::String ^ get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets an eTag value that indicates the state of data targeted for update since the last call to .
Docs.value: A string value that indicates the state of data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The eTag associated with the entity is used to represent original values for use with optimistic concurrency checks according to eTag rules in HTTP [RFC 2616](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=114956).
The value may be empty or null. Null represents the case in which no eTag is currently associated with the entity.

Docs.value: The property corresponds to the element of the that represents the entity in the Atom response.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.EntityDescriptor.ReadStreamUri%2A> property contains the URI for the Media Resource that is associated with the entity, which is a Media Link Entry.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property StreamETag As String
public: property System::String ^ StreamETag { System::String ^ get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the eTag for the media resource associated with an entity that is a media link entry.
Docs.value: A string value that indicates the state of data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.EntityDescriptor.StreamETag%2A> property returns an eTag value that indicates the state of the Media Resource targeted for update since the last call to <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext.SaveChanges%2A> when the entity is a media link entry.
The eTag associated with the media resource is used to represent original values for use with optimistic concurrency checks according to eTag rules in HTTP [RFC 2616](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=114956).
The value may be empty or null. Null represents the case in which no eTag is currently associated with the Media Resource.
